children.subject:
https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1468734 here is a link to Professor Canny's version of the class

https://berkeley-deep-learning.github.io/cs294-131-f17/ here is a link to Professor Song's version of the class

From a previous post, 194-129 is 4 units, whereas Professor Song's version is up to 3 units. 194-129 seems to be more design oriented and 194-33 seems to be more theory/discussion oriented.

history.content:
Dawn Song's course (CS294-131) is a survey course, where each week a speaker comes in and explains their research on deep learning. Lots of people take it just to get 3 units while just submitting their own research as the final project (which is 55% of your grade).

Canny's course is mostly a copy-paste of the popular Stanford CS231N but actually has homeworks, exams, etc.

-----

^ the student is referring to CS 194-131.

I was a reader for 194-129 and I do not have confirmation, but last I talked to Prof. Canny he told me Prof. Song is teaching it next spring. So I expect 194-33 to be the same thing as 194-129.

children.subject: It would be Professor Song’s first time teaching it, seeing as it’s only been offered twice.
Out of curiosity, who is generally believed to be the better teacher of the course? Professor Canny or Professor Song?

history.content: What differences can I expect between 194-129 (Designing, Visualizing and Understanding Deep Neural Networks) with Canny and CS 194-33 (Undergraduate Deep Learning) with Song?
history.subject: CS 194-129 v. CS 194-33
